document_title: Otitis media with effusion: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_name: viem-tai-giua-u-dich.json_7_Prevention of otitis media with fluid retention
subsection_content:
In preventing otitis media with effusion, Dr. Huong advises people to:
Keep ears dry and clean; Avoid letting water, foreign objects, and insects get into your ears; Avoid getting ear, nose, and throat diseases, especially sinusitis, tonsillitis, and adenoiditis; Avoid catching flu and other contagious diseases, which can cause otitis media; When the ear, nose, and throat have unusual symptoms that do not go away for more than a week, you need to go to the hospital for specialized examination, especially in children.
You should not remove earwax with hard objects, especially at barbershops because it can increase the risk of infection with pathogens including bacteria, viruses, fungi and the risk of ear damage leading to infection. .(3)
